Pre-Game Insights: New York first baseman Pete Alonso said, 'We’ve answered the bell. We’ve earned the right to play in the postseason. Now this is when we have a great opportunity in front of us.'
Milwaukee Brewers manager Pat Murphy noted, 'They did it by pulling together and playing a certain way, and they know that’s the secret.'
The Brewers have won 12 of their last 14 meetings with the Mets, including a 5-0 win earlier in the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers have a strong running game, stealing 17 bases in six games against the Mets without being caught.
Others: The Brewers' success against the Mets includes a strong running game and defensive capabilities.
